result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Leonard Siegler Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample.  Register as a sex offender per these convictions.  Agents discretion as to if defendant shall have contact with the victims in the future.  As of now no contact with the victims.  Sex offender treatment.

filed on behalf of defendant by P.L.
filed by attorne Geier

Defendant Charles Leonard Siegler in court, in custody with attorney David A Geier.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims mother T. Siegler, made statement.  Statements by State and Defense.  Court sentenced defendant on each count to serve 18 years in prison.  9 years initial confinement, 9 years extended supervision on each count, concurrent to each other and any other sentence previously imposed.  Conditions of extended supervision include: sex offender treatment, submit DNA sample, Ct. 1 $518.00 costs, Ct. 2 $268.00 costs.  Register as a sex offender per these convictions.  Agents discretion as to if defendant shall have contact with the victims in the future. As of now no contact with the victims.  711 days credit.  1:56/2:40
filed by defendant/counsel

11:10 A.M., Defendant Charles Leonard Siegler in court in custody with attorney David A Geier.  Clifford Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses jury trial dates, Court will schedule the Jury Trial for 10/24/16, 10/25/16, 10/26/16, and 10/27/16 as a #2 to another trial, if the other trial goes, the December jury trial dates will remain, the 9/19/16 - 9/22/16 will be removed from the Court's calendar, Atty Geier addresses bond, requesting modification, State objects to bond modification, Court reduces cash bond to $5,000.00 cash bond,  upon release defendant is to report to Probation Agent immediately, not to initiate any contact w/juveniles, DOC to monitor defendant w/electronic monitor if possible on extended supervision, no contact w/A.L.R., K.L.S., or T.S., Court would suggest agent impose curfew, Motion to Admit Video, Other Acts Motion to be set in September, and any other motions will be scheduled 9/21/16 at 9:00 A.M., 12:02 P.M.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles Leonard Siegler in court, in custody with attorney David A Geier.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness (Lt. Hoege).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Report by Deputy Menard reviewed by witness.  Cross examination continued.  Redirect by State.   Recross by Atty Geier.  Closing arguments.  Court found probable cause.  Bound defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant entered not guilty pleas. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
